Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the ease with which most people can buy an automatic weapon.
Understate: The claim understates the legal restrictions and requirements for purchasing automatic weapons.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that most people can buy an automatic weapon.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the ability to purchase an automatic weapon is a common occurrence for most people.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the gun Lemon purchased was a semi-automatic weapon, not a fully automatic one.
